verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Korah, <S%H7141><s%> Maschil. <S%H4905><s%> We have heard <S%H8085><s%> with our ears, <S%H241><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> our fathers <S%H1><s%> have told <S%H5608><s%> us, what work <S%H6467><s%> thou didst <S%H6466><s%> in their days, <S%H3117><s%> in the times <S%H3117><s%> of old. <S%H6924><s%>

How thou <S%H859><s%> didst drive out <S%H3423><s%> the heathen <S%H1471><s%> with thy hand, <S%H3027><s%> and plantedst <S%H5193><s%> them; how thou didst afflict <S%H7489><s%> the people, <S%H3816><s%> and cast them out. <S%H7971><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> they got not <S%H3808><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> in possession <S%H3423><s%> by their own sword, <S%H2719><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> did their own arm <S%H2220><s%> save <S%H3467><s%> them: but <S%H3588><s%> thy right hand, <S%H3225><s%> and thine arm, <S%H2220><s%> and the light <S%H216><s%> of thy countenance, <S%H6440><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> thou hadst a favor <S%H7521><s%> unto them.
Thou <S%H859><s%> art my King, <S%H4428><s%> O God: <S%H430><s%> command <S%H6680><s%> deliverances <S%H3444><s%> for Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>
Through thee will we push down <S%H5055><s%> our enemies: <S%H6862><s%> through thy name <S%H8034><s%> will we tread them under <S%H947><s%> that rise up against <S%H6965><s%> us.
For <S%H3588><s%> I will not <S%H3808><s%> trust <S%H982><s%> in my bow, <S%H7198><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall my sword <S%H2719><s%> save <S%H3467><s%> me.
But <S%H3588><s%> thou hast saved <S%H3467><s%> us from our enemies, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6862><s%> and hast put them to shame <S%H954><s%> that hated <S%H8130><s%> us.
In God <S%H430><s%> we boast <S%H1984><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> long, and praise <S%H3034><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
But <S%H637><s%> thou hast cast off, <S%H2186><s%> and put us to shame; <S%H3637><s%> and goest not forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H3808><s%> with our armies. <S%H6635><s%>
Thou makest us to turn <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H268><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> the enemy: <S%H6862><s%> and they which hate <S%H8130><s%> us spoil <S%H8154><s%> for themselves.
Thou hast given <S%H5414><s%> us like sheep <S%H6629><s%> appointed for meat; <S%H3978><s%> and hast scattered <S%H2219><s%> us among the heathen. <S%H1471><s%>
Thou sellest <S%H4376><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%> for naught, <S%H3808><s%> <S%H1952><s%> and dost not <S%H3808><s%> increase <S%H7235><s%> thy wealth by their price. <S%H4242><s%>
Thou makest <S%H7760><s%> us a reproach <S%H2781><s%> to our neighbors, <S%H7934><s%> a scorn <S%H3933><s%> and a derision <S%H7047><s%> to them that are round about <S%H5439><s%> us.
Thou makest <S%H7760><s%> us a byword <S%H4912><s%> among the heathen, <S%H1471><s%> a shaking <S%H4493><s%> of the head <S%H7218><s%> among the people. <S%H3816><s%>
My confusion <S%H3639><s%> is continually <S%H3605><s%> <S%H3117><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> me, and the shame <S%H1322><s%> of my face <S%H6440><s%> hath covered <S%H3680><s%> me,

For the voice <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6963><s%> of him that reproacheth <S%H2778><s%> and blasphemeth; <S%H1442><s%> by reason <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of the enemy <S%H341><s%> and avenger. <S%H5358><s%>

All <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> is come upon <S%H935><s%> us; yet have we not <S%H3808><s%> forgotten <S%H7911><s%> thee, neither <S%H3808><s%> have we dealt falsely <S%H8266><s%> in thy covenant. <S%H1285><s%>
Our heart <S%H3820><s%> is not <S%H3808><s%> turned <S%H5472><s%> back, <S%H268><s%> neither have our steps <S%H838><s%> declined <S%H5186><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> thy way; <S%H734><s%>
Though <S%H3588><s%> thou hast sore broken <S%H1794><s%> us in the place <S%H4725><s%> of dragons, <S%H8577><s%> and covered <S%H3680><s%> <S%H5921><s%> us with the shadow of death. <S%H6757><s%>
If <S%H518><s%> we have forgotten <S%H7911><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of our God, <S%H430><s%> or stretched out <S%H6566><s%> our hands <S%H3709><s%> to a strange <S%H2114><s%> god; <S%H410><s%>
Shall not <S%H3808><s%> God <S%H430><s%> search <S%H2713><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> out? for <S%H3588><s%> he <S%H1931><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> the secrets <S%H8587><s%> of the heart. <S%H3820><s%>

Yea, <S%H3588><s%> for <S%H5921><s%> thy sake are we killed <S%H2026><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> long; we are counted <S%H2803><s%> as sheep <S%H6629><s%> for the slaughter. <S%H2878><s%>
Awake, <S%H5782><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> sleepest <S%H3462><s%> thou, O Lord? <S%H136><s%> arise, <S%H6974><s%> cast <S%H2186><s%> us not <S%H408><s%> off forever. <S%H5331><s%>
Wherefore <S%H4100><s%> hidest <S%H5641><s%> thou thy face, <S%H6440><s%> and forgettest <S%H7911><s%> our affliction <S%H6040><s%> and our oppression? <S%H3906><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> our soul <S%H5315><s%> is bowed down <S%H7743><s%> to the dust: <S%H6083><s%> our belly <S%H990><s%> cleaveth <S%H1692><s%> unto the earth. <S%H776><s%>
Arise <S%H6965><s%> for our help, <S%H5833><s%> and redeem <S%H6299><s%> us for thy mercies' sake. <S%H4616><s%> <S%H2617><s%>
